document.masterDocTitle: Description of female adult and praniza larva of Tenerognathia visus Tanaka, 2005 (Crustacea; Isopoda; Gnathiidae) with notes on mating behavior

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of female adult and praniza larva of Tenerognathia visus Tanaka, 2005 (Crustacea; Isopoda; Gnathiidae) with notes on mating behavior

bibRefCitation.author: Tanaka, K.
bibRefCitation.refString: Tanaka, K. (2005) A new genus and species of gnathiid isopod (Isopoda, Gnathiidae) from the Ryukyus, southwestern Japan. Journal of Crustacean Biology, 25 (4), 565 - 569. https: // doi. org / 10.1651 / C- 2605.1

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tenerognathia visus
Tanaka, 2005: 565
[ type locality: Cape Maeda, Okinawa-jima Island, Japan , 26Â°26Â´N , 127Â°46Â´E ].â€”

subSubSection.paragraph: Material examined . NSMT-Cr26752, 6 adult males, 5 adult females, and 5 third-stage praniza larvae, Yonara-suido channel (24Â°33Â´91.1Â´Â´N, 123Â°94Â´80.6Â´Â´E), 0â€“10 depths, off Kohama-jima Is., Ryukyu Islands, Japan during night on 3â€“4 November 2012 .
Description. As morphologies of adult male were well described in original description, this study omitted most part of description and shows other details of morphology.

Adult male ( Fig. 1 ). Total length of body 1.3â€“2.1 mm (mean Â± SD, 1.8 Â± 0.4 mm ; n = 6). Pigmentation of live specimens entirely reddish. Cephalosome ( Fig. 1A, B ) elliptical with three pairs of setae and narrow ridge on frontal border; mediofrontal process present. Compound eyes occupies whole of the cephalosome and mesial margins in contact ( Fig. 1B ). Mandibles short and not well-developed with one mandibular seta ( Fig. 1B ). Pleotelson ( Fig. 1D, E ) with acute apex; with three or two pairs of setae.

Adult female ( Figs 2 , 3 ). Body length 2.0â€“ 2.2 mm (mean Â± SD, 2.1 Â± 0.1 mm ; n = 5). Pigmentation of live specimens entirely whitish. Cephalosome ( Fig. 2A ) with one pair of setae. Frontal border straight. Pereonite 1 not fused to cephalosome, reaching lateral margin. Pereonite 2 and 3 convex. Pereonite 3 wider than pereonite 2 with seta on lateral margin. Pereonite 4â€“6 swollen with two sutures. Lateral shields of pereopods 3â€“5 visible dorsally. Pereonite 7 reduced, overlapping pleopod 1. Pleonite 1â€“5 ( Fig. 2A, B ) each with pair of setae on lateral margin. Epimera prominent on pleonites 1â€“5. Pleotelson ( Fig. 2B, C ) triangular with scales on dorsal surface. Two pairs of setae on dorsal surface and distal margin, respectively.
Antennula ( Fig. 2D ) composed of three basal and four flagellar articles. One or two setae on distal margins of 3 basal articles. One aesthetasc each on flagellar articles 3 and 4.
Antenna ( Fig. 2E ) composed of four basal and seven flagellar articles. One feather-like bristles on peduncular article 3.

Maxilliped ( Fig. 3A ) consists of coxa with attached oostegite, basis and four-articled palp. Tips of endite reaching half-length of palp article 1. Two simple setae on inner margin of palp article 1. Three, five, and three plumose setae on inner margins of palp articles 2, 3, and 4, respectively. Five setae on distal margin of palp article 4.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Adult male of
Tenerognathia visus
(NSMT-Cr26752; total length 1.3 mm). A, whole body in dorsal view; B, frontal border with mandibles in dorsal view; C, pleotelson in dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pylopod ( Fig. 3B ) composed of three articles; article 1 curved and fringed with setae on inner margin; article 2 rectangular with one seta, and article 3 minute. Pylopodal oostegite semi-oval.

Pereopod 2 ( Fig. 3C ) almost same structure as in male adult of
T. visus
; basis rectangular with one simple seta distally; ischium triangular with five simple setae; merus rectangular with five simple setae distally; carpus with two simple setae and one denticulated compound seta; propodus rectangular, bearing two denticulate compound setae on inner-mid and inner-distal margins; dactylus terminal unguis robust and ventral claws.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2. Female adult of
Tenerognathia visus
(NSMT-Cr26752; total length 2.0 mm). A, whole body in dorsal view; B, pleonites and pleotelson in dorsal view; C, pleotelson in dorsal view; D, antennula; E: antenna.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pereopod 3 similar to pereopod 2. Pereopods 4â€“6 narrower and longer than those of pereopods 2 and 3.
Uropodal rami ( Fig. 2C ) extend beyond apex of pleotelson; endopod and exopod fringed with nine simple setae, respectively; four penicillate setae on endopod.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. Female adult of
Tenerognathia visus
(NSMT-Cr26752; total length 2.0 mm). A, left maxilliped in ventral view; B, left pylopod in ventral view; C, right pereopod 2; D, left pleopod 2.

subSubSection.paragraph: Third-stage praniza larva ( Fig. 4 ). Body length 1.9â€“2.4 mm (2.2 Â± 0.2, n = 5). Pigmentation of live specimens entirely reddish. Cephalosome ( Fig. 4A, B ) semicircular, length approximately 0.6 times width. Clypeus length approximately 0.4 cephalosome length; concave anterior margin. Eyes approximately 0.6 cephalosome length and inner margin not reaching basis of antennae. Pereonite 1 ( Fig. 4B ) axially thin, length less than basal width of cephalosome. Lateral shields of pereonites 3â€“6 visible in dorsal view, and elliptical. Pair of setae on dorsal surface of pereonite 2 and 3. Pereonite 7 reduced, overlapping pleopod 1.

Pleonite 1â€“5 ( Fig. 4A ) lengths subequal, with two pairs of setae on lateral margins. Epimera prominent on pleonite 5. Pleotelson ( Fig. 4C ) with three pairs of short setae, almost same shape as that of male adults.
Antennula ( Fig. 4D ) composed with three basal and four flagellar articles. Two penicillate setae on basal article 2. One aesthetasc on each flagellar articles 2, 3, and 4.
Antenna ( Fig. 4E ) composed with four basal and seven flagellar articles; one penicillate seta on distal margin of basal article 3.
Pereopod 1 ( Fig. 4J ) with distinct spine on distal margin of ischium. Carpus triangular with one distal seta; propodus with one seta on distal margin; unguis well curved.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. Third-stage praniza larva of
Tenerognathia visu
s (NSMT-Cr26752; total length 2.1 mm). A, whole body in dorsal view; B: cephalosome in dorsal view; C, pleotelson in dorsal view; D, left antennula; E, right antenna; F, mandible; G, paragnath; H, maxillula; I, right maxilliped; J, right gnathopod; K, right pereopod 2; L, left pleopod 2.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pereopod 2 ( Fig. 4K ) stouter than that of female adult; basis with two penicillate setae; merus and carpus with one long denticulate compound seta on distal margin; propodus with two denticulate compound setae on inner-mid and inner-distal margins; dactylus terminal unguis robust and ventral claws.

Pereopod 3 with almost same morphology. Pereopods 4â€“6 longer than pereopods 2 and 3. Pleopod 2 ( Fig. 4L ) with fan-shaped exopod and oval-shaped endopod. Both rami fringed with setae. Nine plumose setae on exopod. Nine plumose setae on endopod. Uropodal rami ( Fig. 4C ) not extend apex of pleotelson. Exopod with four simple setae and four plumose setae and endopod with two simple setae and five plumose setae. One penicillate seta on endopod.
